text: Linton Clarke Freeman (1927 - August 17, 2018) was an American structuralist sociologist and editor. He was born in Chicago, Illinois. Freeman was known for his work in social networks. He was an emeritus professor of Sociology at the University of California, Irvine. Freeman was the first to create the metric of Betweenness centrality. He was the founding editor of the journal Social Networks.
